meanings.definition: To move quickly and suddenly in an upward direction.
meanings.sent1: The squirrel updarted into the tree when it heard a loud noise.
meanings.sent2: The balloon updarted into the sky as soon as it was released.
meanings.sent3: The kite updarted into the air, surprising the children playing in the park.
meanings.sent4: Her spirits updarted like a rocket when she received good news.
meanings.sent5: The rocket updarted into space, leaving a trail of smoke behind.

meanings.sent1: The loud bang updarted the cat, making it jump in fright.
meanings.sent2: The magician updarted the audience with his unexpected trick.
meanings.sent3: The surprise party updarted the birthday girl, bringing tears of joy to her eyes.
meanings.sent4: The sudden thunderstorm updarted the picnic attendees, causing chaos.
meanings.sent5: The scary movie updarted the viewers, making them scream in terror.

meanings.sent1: She quickly updarted her phone to get the latest software version.
meanings.sent2: The website updarted its content to provide current information to users.
meanings.sent3: The chef updarted the menu with new seasonal dishes.
meanings.sent4: The teacher updarted the students on the upcoming test schedule.
meanings.sent5: The company updarted its logo to give it a modern look.
